item.title: Bang & Olufsen MMC Cartridge Protector: Dimensionally True Reproduction with Stereolithography
item.description:
I recently decided to test out the clear resin (sometimes referred to as “maker juice”) on my Formlabs Form 1 printer. I chose to design a replica of a Multi Media Card (MMC) cartridge protector, as they always seem to go missing. While I own multiple MMC cartridges, I only had one remaining protector. As you can see in the images, the finished product is pretty good! The term “transparent” might be subjective, as the 3D-printed clear material doesn’t quite match the real thing...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/bang-olufsen-mmc-cartridge-protector-dimensionally-true-reproduction-with-stereolithography/

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5513): RPM Stability Test and an Updated Display on the BeoloverRPM Device
item.description:
I dedicated time to program the compact display integrated into my BeoloverRPM device. This enhancement enables precise RPM adjustments and long-term RPM stability analysis. The display now includes minimum and maximum values, along with the total measurement duration. Here’s a glimpse of the display: The display boasts high resolution and excellent contrast. However, those of us who are getting older might need reading glasses to decipher the small font. Is perfection ever attainable?..
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4002-5513-rpm-stability-test-and-an-updated-display-on-the-beoloverrpm-device/
